alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 5:05AM MST until January 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAIN SNOW TO WESTERN AND NORTHERN NEW MEXICO TODAY THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A vigorous low pressure system will approach New Mexico late this morning and pass over the Four Corners tonight before exiting into northeast Colorado on Monday. The areas most likely to observe significant snow in New Mexico will be the high elevations above 8,000 feet in western and northern New Mexico where generally 6 to 12 inches of fresh snow accumulations are possible. Lower elevation areas will initially observe rainfall before changing to snow tonight. Locally higher amounts above 10,000 feet are possible. Areas of reduced visibility and snow-packed mountain roads are possible during this time, and strong winds may create areas of blowing snow, further reducing visibility. Snow levels will fall this evening when the heaviest snow is expected. Periods of light to occasionally moderate snow may continue through the day Monday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches above 7500 feet with lesser amounts of 1 to 4 inches below. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph may create areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, and South Central Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 8 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire chains may be necessary if traveling through mountain passes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
